title: Another Reason to Love IKEA...
content:
Hello All:

Custom type is irksome to the person (like myself) that wants access to it all. But don’t we love the results.

Here is a refined Century Italic to enjoy:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905085635im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/Unknown_5109.png)

I also like the slabs they have added to the romans. Hmm... moderns and slabs mixed together—has this even been done before?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905085635im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/Picture1_6689.png)

Don’t get me started on the IKEA Futura too. Love that too.

Mikey :-)
author: SuperUltraFabulous

comments.content: Context? This is a personal blog. ;^) It can be as random as anything.
Actually I’m in my own context. At least I’m talking about type not politics.

I love IKEA’s design, too... but even they make mistakes:

[
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905085635im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/ikea_5191.jpg)
](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905085635/http:/www.flickr.com/photos/eeblet/1350499341/)

(Unless it’s Swedish custom for men to don a dress when tickling babies.)

I love IKEA for taking photos. No one ever seems to take notice, even when I have my big honking lens.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905085635im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/fpx042708-71_6326.jpg)

Beth I have seen that here too. The restroom is Men’s only until you have a baby then your wife can come in too.

And your right that IKEA messes up sometimes. I sent then a nastygram not that long ago regarding a sloppy negligence going on with their fluorescent bulb and battery recycling bins. The bins were so full they could not close. I also did not like the fact mercury laden broken bulbs were sitting a porous wood bin—they should be lined and better maintained.

But at least IKEA recycles so that’s a plus.

Besides that, I LOVE there kitchen products and their new summer collection. This is the only place that I can get a good price on large (glazed) pots for the patio. Also, I love the dinnerware. I bought 25 of the 365+ dinner bowls there were on sale for .99 cents!

Now Dennis why is it that you can take cool photos with a hulking camera and I, little ’o me, can’t sniff the Persian kilims without a Chinese lady looking at me like I’m a perv? I just happen to love the way jute and wool smell okay- sheesh :-)

Mikey :-)
